titles.title: Professional Boxing Safety Act of 1995
To require professional boxers to wear headgear during all professional fights in the United States.

bill.summary: 3/7/1995--Introduced. Professional Boxing Safety Act of 1995 - Requires professional boxers to wear headgear that meets standards established by the International Olympic Committee during all professional boxing matches. Authorizes the Attorney General to impose a civil monetary penalty (of up to $1 million per violation) against any State boxing authority determined to have allowed a boxer to participate in a professional boxing match without such headgear.
